page.title: 17The Cemetery-Dorking NE
page.content: Dorking Cemetery was opened in 1856.It has slowly got bigger and now covers about six acres and has one chapel still in use .Only about one fifth of the population is now {buried}-the rest are{cremated}.Most of the sandstone{tombstones}are wearing away but these are still interesting because of the beautiful hand carving and sculpture.Some of them have marbled family vaults beneath.Modern gravestones are small,factory made and often carved by a computerized jig. Cemetery{records}now only give limited,less interesting information than the old ones did. There are 3 workers.Two men are about 20yrs. They all need a special temperament for the job.We were lucky to see a monkey puzzle tree in flower.There were yews and box trees and some{wild orchids.
